content.description: The route just right of the gully coming down the East Corridor Wall. The center of four routes on the wall. Another slabby decent moderate.
content.protection: 4 bolts to anchors. Bring a long cordelette if you are going to top-rope this route as the anchors are way back from the edge of the climb.

content.description: Work your way up the face past a little "twig" growing out of a horizontal.  The route gets a little thin.  Interesting moves.
content.protection: 3 draws for the climb and two foot slings for the anchors.
content.location: This route is located between Unconstrained and High Stepping.  Start just right of a large flat rock.

content.description: Good moderate. Route is at the far left side of East Corridor Wall, left of a small gully and just behind a very large boulder.  Watch out for poison oak in the crack on the right.
The furthest right on the East Corridor wall (NOT inside the corridor). Again, slabby like the others on this wall. A bit tricky in the middle after the first bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to anchors. Bring a long cordelette if you are going to top-rope this route as the anchors are way back from the edge of the climb.

content.description: The cleanest crack at Mentmore, this offwidth is also a bit of burlfest.  Starting out as just barely too small to chimney, it steadily narrows down, reaching fist-size at the very top.  The fact that it's just off-vertical, plus the presence of helpful crimps and footholds, keeps it at the grade.  This is probably one of the safest trad leads at Mentmore if you've got the gear for it, since the rock inside the crack is really quite good.  A great climb if you like it wide!
content.protection: Bring the big guys!  The top is just barely narrow enough to take a #4 C4.  Everything below that is going to need 5s and 6s.  In a perfect world, maybe bring C4s: 1x 4, 2x 5-6.  Or just walk a single big cam all the way to the top... it's mostly 5-sized.   There are no fixed anchors.  If you want to TR it, either build a gear anchor, or use the bolts on either side and a gear directional.
content.location: The obvious, clean, offwidth splitter in the east wall of the corridor.  It's the only crack there, you can't miss it!  (Between "High Stepping" and "Butter Toes")

content.description: Describes the wall left of the (02) The Corridor.
